author: cbs8
title: Following Pope Francis' U.S. visit, Georgia's Saint Francis Band Selected as the October Artist of the Month at the Franciscan Sisters' http://fscc-calledtobe.org/
text:
Enjoy a free download of their Song "St. Francis' and a streaming concert of three of their songs - "Cassidy's Sky", "Teacher" and "Jericho"
 GREEN BAY, WI, October 08, Following Pope Francis' United States visit and the October month of St. Francis, featuring the Saint Francis Band's "St. Francis' at the Franciscanized World is most timely. Singer-Songwriter J. Scott Baston reflected "I write each song from a Non-Fiction point of view, and the subject are focused around real situations, events, emotions, etc. I think that as people come to hear the featured songs; my hopes is that the raw emotion of each tune will evoke feelings of a deep spiritual nature from which they come, and apply that too their own reality."
The Saint Francis Band was born from a wealth of experience and knowledge, denouncing negative ego, and replacing it with humanitarianism, and love through the power of music. Their collaboration is one of creative force, radiating from the purest of hearts with the most genuine of souls. The content of their songs relate to everyone through the power of music.
Recordings include the album "One of Many"; the single, "Revolution Radio"; and currently in production an album at Omni Sound in Nashville with Tommy Cooper producing and engineering, and John Keane Studios in Athens.
A special streaming concert of three of their songs is also featured at the Franciscanized World News Page: "Cassidy's Sky", "Teacher" and "Jericho"
Established in 1869, the Roman Catholic Franciscan Sisters of Christian Charity serve in Catholic Health Care, Education and Parish-Community Service in the Southwest, Central and Upper Midwest. Their Franciscanized World News Page offers updates on the sister's latest ministries and vocations, and celebrates seeing the world as St. Francis and St. Clare did: the good and holy possibility in the culture of everyday life.
The Future Is Ours - The Calling Is Yours. Ask us about about this Fall's Discernment Retreats for 20 Something Women and Vocations Conversations near your home.
